Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Maculatin 1.2 (Ala-rich; XXA, natural AMPs; UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: AMP Significance: Streptococcus uberis is recognized around the world as the problem mastitis bug. This peptide appears to be particularly effective in eliminating this bug.Chemical modification:  C-terminal NH2. A=26%.Activity: Activity against B.cereus (MIC >100 ug/ml), L.lactis (MIC >100 ug/ml), L.innocua (MIC >100 ug/ml), M.luteus (MIC >100 ug/ml), P.multocida (MIC >100 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 50 ug/ml), S. uberis (MIC 6 ug/ml), S.epidermidis (MIC >100 ug/ml), S.faecalis (MIC >100 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC >100 ug/ml).Updated 7/2021, Jan2023; 12/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Rozek T, Waugh RJ, Steinborner ST, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Wallace JC.1998, Australia
Literature Information.Title: The maculatin peptide from the skin glands of the tree frog Litoria genimaculata. A comparison of the structures and antibacterial activities of maculatin 1.1 and caerin 1.1
